pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with President Sauli Niinistö of Finland | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
The Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, spoke with President Sauli Niinistö of Finland.

Prime Minister Trudeau and President Niinistö discussed bilateral priorities including implementation of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and highlighted the opportunities it creates on both sides of the Atlantic for jobs and economic growth. The Prime Minister conveyed thanks for Finland’s steadfast support for and early ratification of CETA.

The Prime Minister and the President discussed the arbitrary detention of two Canadian citizens in China and the importance of respecting the rule of law, international norms, and judicial independence. The Prime Minister welcomed the European Union’s clear statements calling for the release of the Canadians.

Prime Minster Trudeau congratulated President Niinistö on Finland’s gold medal at the World Junior Hockey Championships on January 5 in Vancouver as well as the success of Finnish players in the National Hockey League.
